title: Prisoner suspected of killing evil paedophile Richard Huckle 'also a sex offender'
text:

A prisoner suspected of killing one of Britain's most notorious paedophiles is himself a convicted sex offender, it is claimed.

Richard Huckle, 33, was killed at HMP Full Sutton, East Yorkshire, where he was serving 22 life terms, on Sunday.

It is believed a home-made blade was used in the fatal attack.

Now The Sun reports that Paul Fitzgerald, 29, is the prime suspect.

Fitzgerald, who is serving an indefinite jail sentence for a 2009 attack on a woman as she walked her dog, once reportedly boasted: "I love raping women."

His trial at Leeds Crown Court heard the words were written in his diary.

Fitzgerald, from Northern Ireland, was convicted of assault with intent to commit a sexual offence, possession of an offensive weapon and breaching a sexual offences prevention order.

An insider told The Sun after Sunday's killing: "There was blood everywhere.

"The air ambulance was called in but by then it was too late. It was a targeted attack - there was no chance of saving him."

Paedophile Huckle, from Ashford, Kent, was jailed after confessing to 71 charges of vile sex abuse against children.

Huckle's campaign of terror against children, some as young as six months old, lasted for nine years.

(Image: PA)

The former teacher targeted vulnerable and poverty-stricken children while working in South East Asia.

He had been ordered to spend at least 25 years behind bars.

He was only 28 when he was locked up for his "campaign of rape" and was being held in a prison containing some of the country's most dangerous men.

Huckle pleaded guilty to an unprecedented 71 charges, but police believe he may have been responsible for many more offences.

He boasted about how easy it was to abuse children from impoverished backgrounds and even created a "truly evil" manual for other paedophiles.

The sick paedophile had also created a ledger, which contained horrific details of his abuse.

Huckle scored the scale of abuse that each victim suffered and from these sick notes, officers believe he could have targeted up to 200 young victims.

(Image: Central News)

Police are investigating his death.

A statement from Humberside Police said: "Humberside Police are working closely with the Prison Service to investigate the death of an inmate and at this time we are treating the death as suspicious."

The Ministry of Justice declined to comment.
description: Paul Fitzgerald, 29, is reportedly the prime suspect in the murder of Huckle, who raped and abused 200 children, at HMP Full Sutton
